    Abel Hegedus, Zoltan Ujhelyi

    • Method Detail

      • fireUntil

        public <Match extends org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> boolean fireUntil(BatchTransformationRule<Match,?> rule,
                                                                                        com.google.common.base.Predicate<Match> breakCondition)
        Executes the selected rule with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of its preconditions and the break condition is not fulfilled. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireUntil

        public <Match extends org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> boolean fireUntil(BatchTransformationRule<Match,?> rule,
                                                                                        com.google.common.base.Predicate<Match> breakCondition,
                                                                                        org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.lib.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>... filterParameters)
        Executes the selected rule with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of its precondition and the break condition is not fulfilled. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireUntil

        public <Match extends org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> boolean fireUntil(BatchTransformationRule<Match,?> rule,
                                                                                        com.google.common.base.Predicate<Match> breakCondition,
                                                                                        org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.evm.api.event.EventFilter<? super Match> filter)
        Executes the selected rule with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of its precondition and the break condition is not fulfilled. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireUntil

        public void fireUntil(BatchTransformationRuleGroup rules,
                      com.google.common.base.Predicate<org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> breakCondition)
        Executes the selected rules with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of any of their preconditions and the break condition is not fulfilled. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireWhilePossible

        public <Match extends org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> boolean fireWhilePossible(BatchTransformationRule<Match,?> rule)
        Executes the selected rule with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of its precondition. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireWhilePossible

        public <Match extends org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> boolean fireWhilePossible(BatchTransformationRule<Match,?> rule,
                                                                                                org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.evm.api.event.EventFilter<? super Match> filter)
        Executes the selected rule with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of its preconditions. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireWhilePossible

        public void fireWhilePossible(BatchTransformationRuleGroup rules)
        Executes the selected rules with the selected filter as long as there are possible matches of any of their preconditions. The matches are executed one-by-one, in case of conflicts only one of the conflicting matches will cause an execution.

      • fireOne

        public <Match extends org.eclipse.incquery.runtime.api.IPatternMatch> void fireOne(BatchTransformationRule<Match,?> rule)
        Selects and fires an activation of the selected rule with a corresponding filter.

        Warning: the selection criteria is not specified - it is neither random nor controllable
